title: Pulmonary Hypertension Drug Transfer to Heart Failure

ENABLE_trials.safety_concerns: Fluid retention, peripheral edema, weight gain

MELODY_trial.notes: Significant fluid retention in 7/31 macitentan vs 4/32 placebo

SERENADE_trial.notes: No benefit, possible harm in HFpEF

endothelin_receptor_antagonists.conclusion: CONTRAINDICATED - Class effect of fluid retention

SilHF_trial.notes: Did not improve symptoms, QoL, or exercise capacity vs placebo

earlier_studies.notes: Reduced pulmonary vascular resistance, improved exercise capacity

pde5_inhibitors.conclusion: INCONCLUSIVE - Mixed results, no large positive trials

VICTORIA_trial.effect_size: 10% reduction in CV death + HF hospitalization

sgc_stimulators.conclusion: VALIDATED via Vericiguat - FDA approved for HFrEF

sgc_stimulator_class.precision_implication: Model correctly identifies sGC stimulator mechanism

key_findings: 1. Model correctly predicts sGC stimulator mechanism (Riociguat→HF) - VALIDATED by Vericiguat approval
2. Model INCORRECTLY predicts endothelin antagonists (Bosentan, etc.) - Fluid retention risk
3. Model INCORRECTLY predicts prostacyclin analogs - INCREASED MORTALITY in FIRST trial
4. PDE5 inhibitors (Sildenafil, Tadalafil) remain inconclusive - no large positive trials
5. Critical insight: Same target class may have opposite effects (sGC stimulators vs prostacyclins)
production_recommendations: ADD TO CONFIDENCE FILTER: Endothelin receptor antagonists for heart failure (fluid retention)
ADD TO CONFIDENCE FILTER: Prostacyclin analogs for systolic heart failure (mortality risk)
RETAIN: sGC stimulator predictions for heart failure (Vericiguat-validated mechanism)
DOWNGRADE: PDE5 inhibitor predictions for heart failure (inconclusive evidence)
validation_type: mixed - partial validation with important contraindications discovered
